subject: RE: [junit] Servlet And JSP JUnit Testing.
msgSnippet: You can black box test Servlets and JSPs with HttpUnit (http://www.httpunit.org ). For white box testing of Servlets I believe J2EEUnit will allow that
messageBody:
You can black box test Servlets and JSPs with HttpUnit
(http://www.httpunit.org ). For white box testing of Servlets I believe
J2EEUnit will allow that (http://j2eeunit.sourceforge.net/), although I
haven't looked too closely at J2EEUnit so I'm not 100% sure. And since JSPs
are servlets in disguise you should be able to test those aswell.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: selena su [mailto:selena.su@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 02, 2001 2:15 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Servlet And JSP JUnit Testing.
>
>
> Hi There:
> Is there any methodologies to test on Servelt and JSP
> using JUnit ?
> Another words, how am i going to test on Servlet and JSP ?
>
> cheers,
